sen.j: 壱伎韓国（いきのからくに、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: IKI no Karakuni (dates of birth and death unknown) lived during the Asuka period in Japan.
IKI no Karakuni (dates of birth and death unknown) lived during the Asuka period in Japan.
IKI no Karakuni (dates of birth and death unknown) lived during the Asuka period in Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: The reading in the old Japanese syllabary characters is the same.
The reading in the old Japanese syllabary characters is the same.
The reading in the old Japanese syllabary characters is the same.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は史 (姓)。
sen.e: The kabane (hereditary title) is Huhito.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Fubito.
sen.cmt: 時制を直します。固有名詞読み間違いがあります。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Fubito.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で、大友皇子（弘文天皇）側の将となり、河内国から倭（大和国）に進攻したが、葦池の側の戦いで敗れた。
sen.e: He became a commander of OTOMO no Miko (Emperor Kobun) in the Jinshin War, 672, and attacked Wa (Yamato Province) from Kawachi Province but was defeated in the Battle by the Ashiike pond.

In the Jinshin War of 672, he became commander of the army of Otomo no Miko (Prince Otomo who has been called Emperor Kobun after the Meiji period), and advanced to Yamato (Yamato Province) from Kochi (Kawachi) Province, however was defeated in the Battle of Ashiike.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。「倭」は「やまと」という地名。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War of 672, he became commander of the army of Otomo no Miko (Prince Otomo who has been called Emperor Kobun after the Meiji period), and advanced to Yamato (Yamato Province) from Kochi (Kawachi) Province, however was defeated in the Battle of Ashiike.

sen.j: 壱伎氏（伊岐氏）は、渡来系の氏族である。
sen.e: IKI clan were known as immigrants to ancient Japan.
The Iki clan were immigrants to ancient Japan.
The Iki clan were immigrants to ancient Japan.

sen.j: 壬申の乱勃発時の地位は不明だが、乱が勃発して間もない6月末には、河内に集結した大軍の総指揮官であった。
sen.e: His status at the time when the Jinshin War broke out is unknown but by the end of June he was the executive commander of the large force gathered in Kawachi.

His status at the outbreak of the Jinshin War is unknown, however soon after the outbreak, by the end of June (in old lunar calendar), he had become suoreme commander of the large force gathered in Kochi (Kawachi).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。固有名詞読み間違い、この時代の「河内」は「かふち」なので「こうち」と訳して「かわち」の説明を加えます。
sen.e: His status at the outbreak of the Jinshin War is unknown, however soon after the outbreak, by the end of June (in old lunar calendar), he had become suoreme commander of the large force gathered in Kochi (Kawachi).

sen.j: その頃河内の東にある倭（大和国）では大伴吹負が大海人皇子（天武天皇）側に立って兵を挙げ、倭京（飛鳥の古都）を占領していた。
sen.e: Around the same time, in Wa (Yamato Province), east of Kawachi, OTOMO no Hukei took the side of OAMA no Miko (Emperor Tenmu) and massed troops and occupied Wakyo (ancient capital of Asuka).

At the same time, in Yamato (Yamato Province), the east of Kochi (Kawachi), OTOMO no Fukei raised an army supporting Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, later became Emperor Tenmu) and occupied Yamato-no-miyako (the old capital of Asuka).
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、固有名詞読み間違いがあります。「倭京」は「やまとのみやこ」、cityを使うならYamato Cityになります。
sen.e: At the same time, in Yamato (Yamato Province), the east of Kochi (Kawachi), OTOMO no Fukei raised an army supporting Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, later became Emperor Tenmu) and occupied Yamato-no-miyako (the old capital of Asuka).

sen.j: これに対して大友皇子側は、北では大野果安が率いる軍を、西では壱伎韓国が率いる軍を動かし、二方面から倭京に向けて兵を進めた。
sen.e: In response, OTOMO no Miko's side moved the ONO no Hatayasu's armed force from the north and IKI no Karakuni's force from the west, and they advanced from two directions towards Wakyo.

Against them, the followers of Otomo no Miko ordered ONO no Hatayasu to move the force from the north, and IKI no Karakuni to move the force from the west, to advance to Yamato-no-miyako from the two directions.
sen.cmt: 訳語を統一、わかりやすくします。
sen.e: Against them, the followers of Otomo no Miko ordered ONO no Hatayasu to move the force from the north, and IKI no Karakuni to move the force from the west, to advance to Yamato-no-miyako from the two directions.

sen.j: 北進しようとしていた吹負は果安の軍に自らの主力をあて、韓国には坂本財らに小部隊を委ねて対応させた。
sen.e: Hukei intended to head north and attacked Hatayasu's force with his main force, and against Karakuni, SAKAMOTO no Takara was left with a small unit to lead and deal with.
Fukei, who had planned to head north, led his main force and attacked Hatayasu's force, and gave small troops to SAKAMOTO no Takara and other commanders to deal with Karakuni's force.
Fukei, who had planned to head north, led his main force and attacked Hatayasu's force, and gave small troops to SAKAMOTO no Takara and other commanders to deal with Karakuni's force.

sen.j: 韓国の軍は、おそらく7月3日頃に、大津・丹比の両道から東進した。
sen.e: he Karakuni's force advanced eastward from both roads of Otsu and Tajihi probably on 3 July.
Probably about July 3, the Karakuni's force advanced eastward from both roads of Otsu and Tajihi.
Probably about July 3, the Karakuni's force advanced eastward from both roads of Otsu and Tajihi.

sen.j: 財らは高安城からこの様子を遠望して、衛我河の西に出撃して戦った。
sen.e: Takara and his troops saw this in the distance from Takayasu-jo Castle, and came out from the west of Egakawa to fight.
Takara and his troops saw that in the distance from Takayasu-no-ki Castle, and went down to the west of Ega-no-gawa River to fight against the Karakuni's troops.
sen.cmt: 誤訳、固有名詞読み間違いがあります。「河の西に」は城のある山からくだってきて「河の西で」戦ったという意味です。
sen.e: Takara and his troops saw that in the distance from Takayasu-no-ki Castle, and went down to the west of Ega-no-gawa River to fight against the Karakuni's troops.

sen.j: 韓国はこの敵を破ったが、そのとき、河内国司守来目塩籠が大海人皇子側に加わろうとして兵を集めていることが露見した。
sen.e: Karakuni defeated his enemy, however he discovered Kawachi Province Kuni no Tsukasa no Kami KUME no Shioko was joining OAMA no Miko and gathering his troops.

Karakuni defeated those enemy's troops, however, at that time, he knew Kochi no kuni no Mikotomochi-no-kami (provincial governor of Kochi [Kawachi] Province) KUME no Shioko had been gathering soldiers to join the force of Oama no Miko.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミス、固有名詞読み間違いがあります。「国司守」は「くにのみこともちのかみ」
sen.e: Karakuni defeated those enemy's troops, however, at that time, he knew Kochi no kuni no Mikotomochi-no-kami (provincial governor of Kochi [Kawachi] Province) KUME no Shioko had been gathering soldiers to join the force of Oama no Miko.

sen.j: 韓国は計画を知って塩籠を殺そうとした。
sen.e: When Karakuni learned this plan he tried to kill Shioko.
When Karakuni learned this plan he tried to kill Shioko.
When Karakuni learned this plan he tried to kill Shioko.

sen.j: 塩籠は自殺した。
sen.e: Shioko committed suicide.
Shioko committed suicide.
Shioko committed suicide.

sen.j: 韓国の軍はおそらく5日に前進を再開し、財らの部隊は戦わずに退却した。
sen.e: Karakuni's force began to advance again probably on the 5th, and the Takara's unit retreated without fighting.
The Karakuni's force began to advance again probably on the 5th, and the Takara's troops retreated without fighting.
The Karakuni's force began to advance again probably on the 5th, and the Takara's troops retreated without fighting.

sen.j: 韓国は大坂道で山を越え、奈良盆地に進入した。
sen.e: Karakuni went over the mountain by Osakado route to enter Nara basin.
Karakuni went over the mountain by Osaka-no-michi route to enter Nara Basin.
Karakuni went over the mountain by Osaka-no-michi route to enter Nara Basin.

sen.j: 一方、大野果安は北の乃楽山（ならやま。今の奈良市）で4日に吹負の本隊を撃破した。
sen.e: On the other hand, ONO no Hatayasu went to the north, Narayama
ONO no Hatayasu, one of his cooperators defeated the Fukei's main troops on the 4th at Mt. Nara (in present Nara City), the north of Yamato-no-miyako.
sen.cmt: 誤訳です。「北の」は前段を受けて「倭京の北」の意味です。括弧内文章が分かれていましたのでルールどおりに直します。オリジナルに「及楽山」とありましたが「乃楽山」の間違いなので直します。
sen.e: ONO no Hatayasu, one of his cooperators defeated the Fukei's main troops on the 4th at Mt. Nara (in present Nara City), the north of Yamato-no-miyako.

sen.j: 果安は南に進んで倭京を遠望できる地点に達したが、その様子から守りが堅いと考えて軍を引き上げた。
sen.e: Hatayasu headed south and reached to the point to see Wakyo in distance, but he learned the defence was too strong and retreated.
Hatayasu headed south and reached to the point to see Yamato-no-miyako from the distance, however he learned the defense was too strong and retreated.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞読み間違いがあります。
sen.e: Hatayasu headed south and reached to the point to see Yamato-no-miyako from the distance, however he learned the defense was too strong and retreated.

sen.j: 美濃国からの増援を得て再結集した吹負の軍は、韓国の軍を迎撃に向かった。
sen.e: Hukei's force received a reinforcement from Mino Province and rallied, then headed to intercept Karakuni's force.
The Fukei's force received reinforcements from Mino Province and rallied, then headed to fight against the Karakuni's force.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: The Fukei's force received reinforcements from Mino Province and rallied, then headed to fight against the Karakuni's force.

sen.j: 両軍の戦いは、葦池のほとりで起こった。
sen.e: Their battle took place by Ashiike.
Their battle took place by Ashiike.
Their battle took place by Ashiike.

sen.j: このとき、吹負軍の騎兵が勇士来目を先頭にして進み、韓国の軍勢の中に突入した。
sen.e: Cavalry of Hukei's force advanced ahead of the hero, Kume, and charged into Karakuni's troops.
At this time, a brave soldier Kume ran ahead of the Fukei's cavalry, and they ran into the Karakuni's troops.
sen.cmt: 訳語選択ミスがあります。
sen.e: At this time, a brave soldier Kume ran ahead of the Fukei's cavalry, and they ran into the Karakuni's troops.

sen.j: 韓国の兵は逃げ出し、韓国もまた軍から離れて独り逃げた。
sen.e: Karakuni and his men fled.
The Karakuni's soldiers ran away and Karakuni himself left the force and ran away by himself.
The Karakuni's soldiers ran away and Karakuni himself left the force and ran away by himself.

sen.j: 吹負は来目に命じて韓国を射させたが、当たらなかった。
sen.e: Hukei ordered Kume to shoot Karakuni but he failed.
Fukei ordered Kume to shoot Karakuni, however the arrow missed him.
Fukei ordered Kume to shoot Karakuni, however the arrow missed him.

sen.j: 韓国は逃げおおせることができたが、軍を再興することはできなかった。
sen.e: Karakuni managed to run but was never able to regain his influence.
Karakuni managed to run away, however he could not rally his soldiers again.
Karakuni managed to run away, however he could not rally his soldiers again.

sen.j: その後の壱伎韓国については記録にない。
sen.e: There is no further description of IKI no Karakuni in the record.
There is no further description of IKI no Karakuni in the record.
